column1: PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and maintain WPM’s data management strategy and architecture

The primary objective of this position is to develop WPM’s data management strategy and develop the team’s new central repository. The data analyst will be responsible for understanding the current and future data needs of the team to turn those requirements into a formalized data management strategy. The analyst will then work with the IT team and WPM associates to deploy a database solution that enables the team to meet the needs of their respective Business Partners. The analyst will leverage TRP’s AWS ecosystem to develop a repository for relational and non-relational data and collect data from an array of applications and other data sources. Improving the data storage capabilities within WPM will provide the necessary foundation to improve the other analytical
column2: forecasting and visualization functions of the team.

column4: eliminate the dependency on MS Office based data storage
column5: and establish the necessary data feeds that will populate the new WPM repository.

column1: Expanding the amount of data sources WPM utilizes will be critical to understanding the fundamental drivers of WPM’s forecasts. column1: CCQI Office Background:
The Cost Control & Quality Improvement (CCQI) Office was established on July 1
column2: 2018 by the Medicaid Cost Containment bill (SB18-266). Positions inside this new Office may focus on the analysis of or efficiency and quality opportunities in utilization
column4: quality and overall cost trends inside the Medicaid
column6: and other health Safety Net programs administered through the Colorado Department of Health Care Policy & Financing. Solutions to achieve the objectives of the Office may present in the form of utilization review
column9: value based and related alternate payment methodologies

column18: oversee cost management program effectiveness and return on investment within the Medicaid

column22: and implementing Evidence-based decisions to best meet the Department's vision

column1: Description of Job

The position will utilize business intelligence software such as COGNOS or TOAD for Data Analysts to write complex queries to extract data from relational databases. The position learns to write complex coding to manipulate data to provide actionable information to answer very specific questions around the operations and evaluation of the Colorado Medicaid program. The position summarizes the data into understandable reports and communicates findings to internal and external customers. The position will use Tableau to produce data visualizations and dashboards. The position will potentially perform work for any unit within the Department to meet business needs. The position works under the guidance of Statistical Analyst II's
column3: IV's and the Data Analysis Section Manager. This position is a data analyst in training. After a successful training period
column4: this position is expected to be reclassed from a Junior Data Analyst (Statistical Analyst I) to a Data Analyst (Statistical Analyst II).
